meanings.definition: To gather or collect (something or someone) into a group or place.
meanings.sent1: The rancher was corralling the sheep into the pen for shearing.
meanings.sent2: The cowboys were corralling the cattle at sunset.
meanings.sent3: The children were corralling their toys before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was corralling the students' attention during the lesson.
meanings.sent5: The volunteers were corralling the donations for the charity event.

meanings.definition: To control or guide (something or someone) in a specific direction or manner.
meanings.sent1: The traffic officer was corralling the cars to ease congestion.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd was corralling the sheep towards the green pasture.
meanings.sent3: The coach was corralling the players to discuss the game strategy.
meanings.sent4: The parent was corralling the kids to get ready for school.
meanings.sent5: The trainer was corralling the horses for the show jumping competition.
